content.question: Three permanent magnets with ends labeled <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>, <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>, <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, are fixed to a table with small pieces of iron sprinkled around the magnets, forming the pattern shown in the figure. Which of the labeled ends have the same polarity as the end labeled <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>
<math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>
<math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>
<math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
